author: Staff Reporter
text:
The remains of a shop on bus stand premises in Namakkal that was gutted due to gas leakage on Tuesday.

A shop owner and a worker died of asphyxiation after fire broke out in a shop located on bus stand premises due to leakage in cylinder on Tuesday.

The incident occurred around 7 a.m., when owner Murugesan (32) of Teachers Colony and worker Senthilkumar (30) of Tiruchi district were involved in transferring gas from LPG cylinder to commercial cylinder in the shop through a motor. Gas leaked from one of the cylinder and fire broke out.

The two attempted to put off the fire. But, the fire spread quickly to the entire shop as they could not get out of the shop. They were rescued by the nearby shopkeepers and were taken to the District Government Headquarters Hospital. But, both died on the way.

Fire and Rescue Services personnel rushed to the spot and put off the fire. Refrigerator and most of the snack items in the shop were destroyed in the fire. The police recovered the cylinders and the motor used for transferring the gas. Post-mortem was conducted and the bodies were handed over to their relatives.
title: Two die of asphyxiation in shop fire in Namakkal
